data.title: Nice and Juicy Burger!
data.text: My sister and I needed a late night snack and the burger totally fit the bill.  Enough for two of us with some to spare!

data.title: vacation
data.text: The food was very good for the two dinners we had there during our stay. The bar tender/waiter was very friendly.

data.title: Enjoyed the Toro Burger Bar
data.text: Just recently my husband and I enjoyed a drink and burger at the Toro Burger Bar while we were staying at the Rio Rancho Howard Johnson's.  The burger and fries were excellent and the staff, Chuck and James, were friendly and accommodating.  We plan to eat there again when we return to Arizona this winter.

data.title: Walt has an amazing staff and great food at this little gem located inside the Howard Johnson motel!
data.text: When I'm traveling across this great country of ours I usually don't think of looking for restaurants at motels.  That's why this little gem located at the Howard Johnsons in Rio Rancho is exactly that, a gem!  Walt does an amazing job with what most people consider a continental breakfast, I've had worse breakfast at four and five star hotels and the burgers... out of this world!  Have them with some sweet tots and you'll be addicted too!  Thanks Walt thanks Howard Johnsons and God bless you all!

data.title: The Toro Burger Bar is Fantastic!
data.text: My husband and I decided to see what the "Burger Bar" in the formerly Toro Bar and Grill at the Rio Rancho Howard Johnson's was like. There was no one in the place when we got there, the lights were off, and we thought it was closed. Then bartender/waiter Chuck welcomed us, turned on the lights, and we had an absolutely fabulous meal! The burgers (put together in all different kinds of ways, any way you like) were melt-in-your-mouth yummy and the fries were hot and crisp. People of Rio Rancho, go out and visit this "new" restaurant! (We're planning to go again next week.)

data.title: Too bad the TORO is Dead
data.text: The TORO Bar & Grill in the HoJo Rio Rancho Inn lobby is Defunct and Closed ~ used for the free breakfast bar

data.title: The service is fantastic, great food.
data.text: Wow. I think the most interesting part about my stay was the fact that I had the chance to meet some amazing waiters/waitresses, etc. The restaurant itself is slightly small looking from the outside, but is quite big inside. The ambient lighting really set the mood, and I must say that the workers there are so very enthusiastic. They were easy to speak with, and they were constantly asking if we needed anything else. The food itself was really great, and I was actually satisfied with the portions they had with what we ordered, even with the desserts.

data.title: The Cheese cake was delicious.
data.text:
At night, I was hungry. So I just ordered piece of cheese cake. I really enjoyed cheese cake. It was most delicious I ever taste.
And waitress was kind for me. Thank you.

data.title: Excellent Food
data.text: Great Food and plentiful. What more can you say but that it is well worth the trip. Staff were great.

data.title: Only Diners there for a reason
data.text: We went to Toro for a New Years Eve Dinner and we were the only ones there with the exception of a couple of people at the bar. We got a seared ahi tuna appetizer that my husband thought was either microwaved or boiled. It was horrible. The garlic mashed potatoes tasted like they were instant srom a box. The steak was so-so at best. Crab cake was a giant hashed brown with a little crab meat in it. The bartender/waitress walked up and down the restaurant texting. It was ridiculous how bad everything was. I'm sure to go in for a beer is fine but beyond that...  First get a chef, second it looks like it's from the 70s and last get a waitstaff. Restaurant Impossible I think we found your next challenge!

data.title: Great food and great service
data.text:
Went as part of a wedding party which had around 20 people for dinner. The wedding itself was held in the gardens at the 'Inn at Rio Rancho' which is adjoining the Toro Bar and Grill. The chef actually did the marriage service.
There was no rush to eat, food service was done whenever we were ready. There was a huge variety of food ordered and every person enjoyed their meal. Service was fantastic, drinks arrived quickly, everyone's meals were served together and the food was lovely. Couldn't fault anything about the food or serving staff.

data.title: BEWARE!!!!
data.text: This place is horrible; I waited over forty five minutes for our server to notice we didn’t have our food and an hour and thirty minutes for the food to arrive because the kitchen “lost our ticket”. When our food did arrive it was cold and wrong, the filet was charbroiled black when it was supposed to be medium well. The rice was hard and cold and when we talked with the manager about it his excuse was “it’s hard to cook rice”, if you’re a cook at a restaurant you should learn that. But he did “take care of us” like he promised. The huge 20% discount on a meal we waited so long for and didn’t eat was perfect. Beware of this place, its run and managed by incompetent people.

data.title: A perfect spot for dinner or a quiet drink with friends
data.text: I have lived in Rio Rancho for 20 years and my husband and I often lament the lack of restaurants and bars up here where we can go to have quiet drinks and a GOOD dinner in a casual environment.  We've finally found a place in Rio Rancho that has a nice bar, good food and a friendly staff!  By "good" food, I mean it is not mass-produced (aka Chilis or Applebees), it is freshly prepared, and nicely presented without costing an arm and a leg. The Toro bar is small and friendly - it has about 10 seats at the bar, several small tables and an open area with couches and comfy seats.  It also has several televisions playing various sporting events (sound off), and music is playing loud enough to be heard in the background, but not so loud that you can't have a conversation.  The bartenders and staff are personable and attentive (something you don't see in bigger, busier bars).  After a long week (or long day) at work, this is a perfect place to unwind and have a conversation over drinks or dinner.  There is a small outdoor patio, but it has been too windy lately to enjoy that.  They also offer live music some evenings, but usually at 8 or 9 pm.  Last night, we had two beers, a soda, fish tacos and the chef's special - stuffed pork loin with veggies and mashed/baked sweet potatoes, all for $28.

data.title: Avoid at all costs
data.text:
We went to the Toro for a family dinner this December. We were greeted at the door by a group of servers. No, they weren't standing at the door to greet us. They were just standing near the door talking to each other and happened to notice we were there. I should have taken this as a sign of what was to come and left immediately.

We were seated and our drink orders were taken. About five minutes later after sitting with our menus closed, a waitress came to take our orders. Our drinks still hadn't shown up. Did I mention that there were only four other families there and about five servers standing in a group talking? We re-ordered our drinks and some chicken wings as an appetizer. The waitress brought our drinks, but said that my husband's beer had to come from the bar and it was going to be a few minutes. Well, we happened to be sitting right next to the bar. The bartender had one customer and was just standing there talking. She talked for a few minutes, then finally poured my husband a beer as we watched in amazement. 
The chicken wings were a joke. Luke warm, five little half wings (the small part) drenched in rancid vinegar and honey for $7. I wanted to complain, but our waitress was gone. In fact, all the servers were gone. We sat there waiting for about 20 minutes and didn't see a soul. Our drinks were empty. Finally, a different waitress came out with some food. The kids and I had burgers and my husband had a steak. All the food tasted like pre-cooked frozen food that you just pop into the microwave--about one step up from a frozen dinner. I would not be surprised if the kitchen didn't even have a stove.

I wish I could say that this was just a bad day for the restaurant, every restaurant has them. But to be honest, we felt like we had been scammed. The restaurant charged high prices for cheap food, and very little work went into the preparation and serving of it. You could go to any other restaurant in Rio Rancho and have a much better experience.

data.title: Fresh Margaritas
data.text: May not look like much from the outside, but very nice bar inside.  Great vodka, tequila and beer selections.  Friendly wait staff and they can mix up one of the best, freshest margaritas in town, made to order!  Tables and carpet give it a very dated look (70s) but bar is great.

data.title: Don't Bother
data.text: Staff was knowledgeable about Tequila characteristics, and although there was only 5 of us in the bar on a Saturday night, they spent way too much time dusting bottles and taking down baseball signs, rather than keeping our glasses full. We were ready to sample different tequilas but their indifference toward us  caused us to leave after just two drinks.  The bar and bar stools are a safety issue and very hard to use and get comfortable with.  Prices were reasonable.

data.title: Great Tequila, Great Food
data.text: I was surprised this place was so quiet.  Our server was very sweet and was very knowledgeable about the menu.  I was really impressed by the bartender who whipped a hibiscus margarita from scratch.  Good sirloin cooked just right.

data.title: pleasant surprise for a hotel restaurant
data.text: My husband and I had a taste for sandwiches and draught beer and decided to try Toro Bar and Grill which we had driven past many times. The full service bar is at the far end of the restaurant that has tables and booths. The atmosphere is casual and the burger was cooked as ordered, juicy and on a fresh roll. One can select from special burgers or the basic with add-ons. The grilled chicken pita panini was thick, juicy and flavorful.  The weakness was the fries that tasted store bought and were luke warm. The draught beer offerings covered the basics plus excellent regionals. Our waitperson was attentive and knowledgeable despite serving double duty as the greeter. We will return to try the specialties and grill options.
